intro: Ivesia utahensis var. campestris, commonly known as the Utah sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. It produces small, showy flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. The species is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
